name: Sheraton Minneapolis Midtown Hotel

reviews.text: Had a conference here and decided to stay right in the hotel. Honestly given it was Minneapolis I should have known better, and went for a Super 8 or Doubletree further away. The rooms are much tinier than they appear online. The beds are stiff and not very comfortable. There is no complimentary continental breakfast, you have to pay for parking on top of your bill. I've stayed in much cheaper and much better hotels in my life.For the money I expected a whole lot more, and seeing the bill for 5 days left a sour taste in my mouth, I got took.
reviews.title: Sokay...but not

likes.liked: — The conference was in the hotel

reviews.text: This hotel looks average on the outside, but the the interior is quite nice and up to par with most of the many Sheraton's I have stayed at. The rooms are large, and well maintained, and the bathrooms were clean and looked new. The fitness center is excellent, and most of the exercise bikes / ellipticals have their own TV built in. There is also a nice fairly large indoor pool. The location is not great though, it sits in a rough looking area outside of downtown Minneapolis, next to a major bus/train station, and there are usually some sketchy looking folks hanging around. There are also no decent food options nearby within walking distance, not that you would want to be walking around in that area anyhow. But other than that, it's a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the ghettos of Minneapolis

reviews.text: Driving up to the hotel, you would never think that a very nice Sheraton would be in this slightly ramshackle neighborhood. There is a rent-a-cop standing outside the door at night as well. Don't let that scare you away, as it's actually quite safe, and the hotel is one of the better Sheraton's at which I have stayed.
reviews.title: What an odd place for a really nice hotel

reviews.text: First off, the Internet was free - typically they make you pay an arm and a leg for it. Second, the room was nicely appointed and everything looked very clean and relatively new. The room size was a bit small, but as a solo business traveler, that does not make much difference. The bathroom was also very nicely designed, with some frosted glass in the bathroom door as a nice touch. The breakfast room service was on time and my waffle was still warm.
reviews.title: Excellent Starwood property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again, particularly if your time took you away from the hotel area. If you're looking for downtown, this is not the place to stay - but if you need a nice place slightly lower in price where you won't spend all your time - this is certainly a place to return to.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in sketchy part of town
Best Sheraton I've Stayed At
reviews.text: I almost didn't book my stay with this hotel because of some of the reviews, but I'm so glad that I went with my hunch. From the minute I walked in the door I felt like I was at home. A young female manager walked by and immediately said, "Welcome" I walked to the front desk and checked in quickly, they even walked around the side of the desk to personally hand me my keys and showed me where the elevator was. Most Sheratons i've stayed at I felt like a number, but this was a great overall experience.

reviews.title: Incompetent staff
reviews.text: I ordered room service and it was quite tasty, the prices were reasonable as well. When I went down to the bar later that evening the manager that welcomed me earlier as I was walking in said hello again to me as soon as I sat down at the bar. Very welcoming, staff in the restaurant was great.

reviews.title: Rude Security, Front Desk.
reviews.text: Although it is a couple miles outside of downtown, they have a free shuttle that brought me to the front door of the building my meeting was in.

reviews.title: A Special Sheraton
reviews.text: I would highly reccomend this hotel, great stay!

reviews.title: Incredible
reviews.text: My friend and I had problems from the beginning. Even though I had booked the room 2 months earlier, when we went to check in, they told me that they had no rooms available. Then, they told me that they could "put a room together" if I paid them more money for the same type of room (2 double beds). I gave them hell. When I asked them what was the purpose of a reservation, they said the reservation is a mere "request". That was certainly news to me.
Great location, basically on Lake which is the place for great (and cheap) Latin food.
reviews.title: Best location!

reviews.text: Large room & bathroom, and a big shower!
reviews.title: The best customer service in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice workout area & changing rooms.
reviews.title: Perfectly located...

reviews.text: Excellent staff.
reviews.title: Pleasant lodging & even better deal

reviews.text: Drawbacks:
reviews.title: Became my home away from home

reviews.text: Spent three nights here for a conference, and found it comfortable, quiet, and well-appointed. Staff were uniformly cheerful, pleasant and courteous, and went above and beyond -- particularly with regard to the shuttle service they provided to and from the conference. The location was good for transit (there's a bus loop right outside) -- frequent buses go to (and past) the Light Rail line which goes downtown, to the airport and beyond to the Mall of America. My room overlooked the bus loop, and the noise from it wasn't intrusive. Room service food was terrific, and arrived ahead of the estimated time; the hamburger I had in the in-house restaurant was also excellent. I liked the Sheraton's option of not having the room made up every day; I can make my own bed and don't need new towels or the toilet cleaned daily, and I appreciated the $5 in-house credit I received for each day I made up my own room. The bathroom had a huge shower stall (no bath) and was quite large in general, though it took me a bit to find the light switch -- located on the wall behind one of the doors -- without a light to find it! The desk ran almost the entire width of the room, which was great to spread my stuff out on.
reviews.title: A south-side gem with great staff

reviews.text: A colleague/friend and I stayed at the Sheraton Midtown to attend a conference in St. Paul. The double room was adequate for our needs. I think the photo of the room on the web site is accurate. The beds were comfortable and there is a good-sized workspace. Our room on the 3rd floor faced downtown and the bicycling path. It was clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Pleasant, clean with friendly, helpful staff

reviews.text: The conference planners had arranged for the hotel to provide shuttle service to and from St. Paul. The hotel also provides shuttle service to and from locations within a 5 mile (I believe) radius so it was extremely easy to be able to get around the city for a bit of sight-seeing too. The driving staff was great!
reviews.title: Nice place, but a little noisy at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is somewhat out of the way and the neighborhood maybe a bit iffy so, again, the shuttle service is a terrific bonus. The hotel is very close to a large, regional hospital so it seems to be a good location for people who wish to be nearby hospitalized family members. The hotel restaurant has a limited menu but the food is good with good-sized portions. Being connected to the Global Market is a plus as a variety of food is available there, as well as shopping and an upbeat atmosphere. This was a good place to eat/shop/spend time to avoid the inclement weather.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, strange location

reviews.text: The pool/spa area was very clean and well maintained. I didn't use the exercise facility but it also looked clean and had a good variety of machines.
reviews.title: nice hotel in an unconventional location

description: Sheraton Minneapolis Midtown Hotel is steps away from the Midtown Global Market, and also close to The Minneapolis Convention Center, Orchestra Hall, Target Center, the Metrodome and Target Field.
